sentences.sContent: The two soldiers saluted Lieutenant Cecil.
sentences.sCn: 那两名士兵向塞西尔中尉行了礼。

sentences.sContent: The men jumped to their feet and saluted.

trans.tranCn: 敬礼； 向…致敬； 问候
trans.tranOther: to move your right hand to your head, especially in order to show respect to an officer in the army, navy etc

trans.tranCn: 敬礼； 鸣礼炮；迎接， 欢迎
trans.tranOther: an act of raising your right hand to your head as a sign of respect, usually done by a soldier to an officer
